newsitem.title: GERMANY: Commerzbank says won't extend T&N option.
newsitem.headline: Commerzbank says won't extend T&N option.

text.p: Commerzbank AG said on Tuesday it did not plan to extend the option of British engineering group T&N Plc to buy the bank's 49.99 stake in German vehicle components maker Kolbenschmidt AG.
"The option will not be prolonged," Commerzbank chief executive Martin Kohlhaussen told reporters at a news conference. T&N's option to buy the stake expires at the end of 1996.

T&N, which already owns German piston ring maker Goetze, has until now been prevented from buying the stake by the German cartel office on the grounds that it would give it too much control of the German pistons market.
An appeal against the cartel office decision has been lodged with a Berlin court.
